replay_script:
#!/bin/bash
set -euo pipefail

# Agent 8 Replay Script - Performance Harness
echo "=== Agent 8: Performance Harness Replay ==="

# Navigate to agent-8 directory
cd /home/user/claude-squad/integrations/kgc/agent-8

# Verify environment
echo "Go version: $(go version)"
echo "GOOS: $(go env GOOS)"
echo "GOARCH: $(go env GOARCH)"
echo ""

# Build the package
echo "Building harness..."
go build . || { echo "Build failed"; exit 1; }
echo "✅ Build successful"
echo ""

# Run all tests
echo "Running tests..."
go test -v -timeout 30s || { echo "Tests failed"; exit 1; }
echo "✅ All tests passed"
echo ""

# Regenerate baseline (optional - for verification)
echo "Baseline already exists at baseline.json"
if [ -f baseline.json ]; then
    echo "✅ Baseline verified"
    cat baseline.json | head -15
else
    echo "⚠️  Baseline missing, regenerating..."
    go run create_baseline.go
fi
echo ""

# Verify all deliverables exist
echo "Verifying deliverables..."
for file in harness.go harness_test.go DESIGN.md baseline.json RECEIPT.json; do
    if [ -f "$file" ]; then
        echo "  ✅ $file"
    else
        echo "  ❌ $file (MISSING)"
        exit 1
    fi
done
echo ""

# Compute output hash for verification
echo "Computing output hash..."
OUTPUT_HASH=$(sha256sum harness.go harness_test.go DESIGN.md baseline.json 2>/dev/null | awk '{print $1}' | sha256sum | awk '{print $1}')
echo "Output Hash: $OUTPUT_HASH"
echo ""

echo "=== Agent 8 Replay Complete ==="
echo "Status: SUCCESS"
echo "All proof targets verified"

design_contract.observable_inputs: Workload W, SampleSize N, Environment E
invariants: Q₃: Sample size validity (len(Runs) = N, N ≥ 5)
proof_targets: Π₁: Determinism - Same workload produces statistically similar results (CV < 0.20)
Π₂: Regression Detection - Regressions exceeding threshold are detected
Π₃: Baseline Persistence - Baselines save/load without precision loss

notes: This harness is designed for REGRESSION DETECTION, not absolute benchmarking
Timings are environment-specific and reproducible within statistical bounds
Workloads must be deterministic for meaningful comparison
Uses Welford's algorithm for numerically stable variance computation
